title: Arc of Infinity
dialogue_disasters: A pulse loop, the very thing. Fetch it, Thalia.
goofs: Leonard Sachs stumbles just before Borusa sentences the Doctor to death
Leonard Sachs stumbles again while talking to Hedin in the third episode
Omega does a quick impression of Reeves and Mortimer's the Ponderers in the third episode
Hedin's sequences get increasingly daft, with Michael Gough required to wave his Time Lord pencil around in ever-increasing excitement
John Nathan-Turner appears on screen in episode four trying to persuade a passer-by not to get into shot

continuity_notes.name: Omega
continuity_notes.description: A renegade Time Lord who survived the events of 'The Three Doctors' and now seeks to bond with another Time Lord to remain in our universe
continuity_notes.current_status: Attempting to bond with the Doctor to reverse his polarity and remain in our universe

continuity_notes.name: TARDIS
continuity_notes.description: The Doctor's time and space machine
continuity_notes.current_status: Damaged navigation system from Cybermen attack in 'Earthshock', recalled to Gallifrey

continuity_notes.name: Gallifrey
continuity_notes.description: Home planet of the Time Lords
continuity_notes.current_status: Capital punishment has long been abolished, but a single precedent for the Doctor's termination exists

continuity_notes.name: Matrix

continuity_notes.current_status: The Doctor finds himself in the Matrix again

continuity_notes.name: Nyssa
continuity_notes.current_status: Traveling with the Doctor, her room is closest to the console room

continuity_notes.name: Tegan
continuity_notes.current_status: Has lost her job and hopes to meet her cousin Colin Frazer

technobabble: Amsterdam is located on the curve of the Arc, below sea-level to maintain pressure for fusion conversion
Rondel is an intergalactic region devoid of all stellar activity, and formerly the location of a collapsed 'Q' star
Q stars emit quad magnetism, the only known 'shield' for anti-matter, although it decays very rapidly
roots: Omega's degeneration echoes The Quatermass Experiment
H. R. Giger (Omega and Ergon design)
An American Werewolf in London (two student types on backpacking holidays)

locations.name: Gallifrey
locations.description: Home planet of the Time Lords
locations.current_status: Appears as a drab, spartan place, almost entirely devoid of Time Lords

locations.name: Amsterdam
locations.description: Earth city where part of the story takes place
locations.current_status: Setting for the 1980s portion of the story

additional_notes: The episode features double entendres and the recurring phrase 'We must act now!'
bottom_line: Despite some flaws in the premise and scenario, the episode offers entertainment with Nyssa's action scenes and the Amsterdam footage. Peter Davison's performance as Omega is particularly noteworthy. However, the depiction of Gallifrey as a drab place is disappointing.
